stories.text:
Lately I began noticing that sometimes I get really slow / unsuable connections to google. When I change my DNS from cloudflare -> google's), it's fast again. It seems that the IP

Has anybody experienced the same?

Right now I'm getting 142.250.102.113 vs 142.251.36.46

Also I get 142.250.102.147 as a response. Now, if I try out the IP addresses I sometimes get (using 3 different connections / servers), I get:

  curl -H "Host: www.google.com"  http://142.250.102.147
  curl: (7) Failed to connect to 142.250.102.147 port 80: 
  Connection refused
Google seems to do evil things again...
stories.title: Google delaying Cloudflare DNS resolved requests?

stories.text:
Is it worth investing in a vpn business nowadays? I doubt it would be very profitable. Maybe if it were 5–10 years ago and you were getting in the business while it was young, sure it could’ve been a great opportunity. But today there are hundreds of different VPN providers, and very few are well known today. Unless you could get a ton of funding and then provide something much better than other providers, you can’t really compete with paid VPNs.
What do you guys say?
stories.title: How to Start a VPN Business?
